tool.name: Step 7: Translation Database
tool.command:
generate_translation_db.pl --result_db "${sqlite_db}" --tis_call "${tis_call}"
#if $tisids.assembl == "all" --tis_ids "${tisids.assembl}" #else if $tisids.assembl == "specific" --tis_ids "${tisids.specific}" #end if
#if $map_can.map_can_op == "id":
--mflag $map_can.mapped_file.mflag
#if $map_can.mapped_file.mflag == "1": --external_ref "${map_can.mapped_file.external_ref}" --extra_info "${map_can.mapped_file.extra_field}" --mapping "${map_can.mapped_file.mapping_db}" --db_config_version "${map_can.mapped_file.db_config_version}"
#else if $map_can.mapped_file.mflag == "2": --mapping "${map_can.mapped_file.mapping_file}" #end if
#else if $map_can.map_can_op == "seq":
--mflag 3 --blast_pgm $map_can.seq_mapping.pgm --blast_db "${map_can.seq_mapping.blast_db.fields.path}"
#if str($map_can.detailPrameter.parameters) == "advance":
--min_blast_length $map_can.detailPrameter.min_blast_length --mslenght $map_can.detailPrameter.mslenght --gapopen $map_can.detailPrameter.gapopen --gapextend $map_can.detailPrameter.gapextend --matrix "${map_can.detailPrameter.matrix}" --identity $map_can.detailPrameter.identity --coverage $map_can.detailPrameter.coverage --evalue $map_can.detailPrameter.evalue
#end if
#else if $map_can.map_can_op == "none": --mflag 4 #end if
--translation_db "${translation_db}"

data.name: translation_db
data.label: Database of non redundant protein sequences

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool generates a non redundant custom protein sequence database from transclation products generated based on known Ensemble transcripts. It removes all duplicate and sub-sequences of the generated transclation products taking into considerations the highrarchy in the table below. It performs a Local BLAST search (using blastp or ublast) against a canonical protein database to map the protein sequences to already annotated proteins.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Input**
A SQLite database with a table containing the tranacript ID, annotation, chromosomes, start positions and start codon. A Blast or USearch formated canonical protein database (e.g. SWISSPROT). An ensemble databse name selected from the list to download biomart mapped Ensembl to Swissprot IDs or a comma seperated text file containing the mapped IDS in the following structure. ::
Ensemble_transcript_ID,Swissprot_Accession,Gene_name ENSMUST00000000033,P09535,IGF2_MOUSE
The annotations are ranked according to the table below with 1 the most important.
::
Annotation | Rank -------------------------------------------------------------- aTIS (annotated TIS) | 1 5UTR (5'untransalted region) | 2 CDS (transclation starting within a coding sequence) | 3 ntr (translation evidence at pseudo-genes) | 4 3UTR (3'untransalted region) | 5 ...
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
A Fasta file of non redundnt translation products database.
------
